email.title: Weekly Digest
email.text:
Hi everyone!
As we're approaching the end of '20/21, this week's digest brings you info on the DoC Summer Term Wellbeing Survey, WiC's list of awards and opportunities and G-Research's Women in Finance event for PhD students.
email.heading: Summer Term Wellbeing Survey
email.text:
Filling out this survey about your mental health and wellbeing this term will help your representatives and DoC address any issues.

email.heading: Women in Computing – awards and opportunities
email.text:
In search of various opportunities in the past year, two DoC girls (Christy Chan [EIE III, WiC] and Chloe Lau [Computing II, DoCSoc]) have compiled a list of awards, opportunities and mentorships for female, non-binary and/or ethnic minority students here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1eR953pIvhC4ZXbDwlOygmBXQUcfRdm7KTSSlK8OmD1o/edit
If you are interested in contributing to the list please contact christy.chan18@imperial.ac.uk or chloe.lau19@imperial.ac.uk.
email.heading: G-Research – Women in Quant Finance – August 2021
email.sponsor:
G-Research is committed to growing the range of voices and perspectives within our industry. We are therefore excited to announce the continuation of our Women’s Engagement Programme with our latest Women in Quant Finance event. After two very successful events in Europe and North America, our next event will be focused on the UK.
This event will include a range of introductory and technical talks, as well as collaborative skills courses and interview prep sessions. Our goal is to give women studying for a PhD the chance to learn more about working in quantitative research in finance, while providing them with the chance to build a network of their peers.
The event will be held at our offices in Central London, with an introductory dinner on Sunday 22 August, followed by a day of talks and workshops from 09:30 to 18:00 on Monday 23 August.
The main day will feature a mix of activities, including:
* A talk by one of our quant researchers, focused on the financial industry * A panel discussion and Q&A session * An interactive case study, giving you the chance to get hands-on with the type of work we do * A drinks and networking session * A games night
If you are selected to take part in the event, we will cover your accommodation (including the night of the 23rd), food, and travel expenses. You will also be guaranteed an interview with G-Research (for either an internship or permanent position).
More information about the event and application process can be found on our website [here](https://www.gresearch.co.uk/article/women-in-quant-finance-august-2021/).
